titleStmt.title: An antidote or treatise of thirty controuersies vvith a large discourse of the Church. In which the soueraigne truth of Catholike doctrine, is faythfully deliuered: against the pestiferous writinges of all English sectaryes. And in particuler, against D. Whitaker, D. Fulke, D. Reynolds, D. Bilson, D. Robert Abbot, D. Sparkes, and D. Field, the chiefe vpholders, some of Protestancy, some of puritanisme, some of both. Deuided into three partes. By S.N. Doctour of Diuinity. The first part.
Antidote or soveraigne remedie against the pestiferous writings of all English sectaries
titleStmt.author: S. N. (Sylvester Norris), 1572-1630.

titleStmt.title: An antidote or treatise of thirty controuersies vvith a large discourse of the Church. In which the soueraigne truth of Catholike doctrine, is faythfully deliuered: against the pestiferous writinges of all English sectaryes. And in particuler, against D. Whitaker, D. Fulke, D. Reynolds, D. Bilson, D. Robert Abbot, D. Sparkes, and D. Field, the chiefe vpholders, some of Protestancy, some of puritanisme, some of both. Deuided into three partes. By S.N. Doctour of Diuinity. The first part.
Antidote or soveraigne remedie against the pestiferous writings of all English sectaries
titleStmt.author: S. N. (Sylvester Norris), 1572-1630.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed at the English College Press] Permissu superiorum,

notesStmt.note: Part 2 has separate dated title page, pagination, and register. Variant: part 2 is a reissue of STC 18657.5, ending on p. 247. Controversies 16-17 are prefixed to it in quires 2*-5*.
The third part called for on the title page is "The guide of faith", published and listed separately (STC 18659).
The two parts originally published separately in 1615 and 1619 as: An antidote or soveraigne remedie against the pestiferous writings of all English sectaries.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
